goals.title: Automate a weekly task with a simple script
goals.description: Pick one repetitive task (renaming files, organizing notes, cleaning a spreadsheet) and automate it end-to-end.
first_steps: List 3 repetitive tasks you do weekly; pick the smallest one.
Write the steps manually once to confirm the workflow.
Implement a minimal script that handles 80% of cases.
Run it weekly and note 1 improvement each run.

goals.title: Ship a small portfolio project in 10 days
goals.description: Build a tiny app that solves a real problem for you (tracker, checklist, quiz, habit timer) and publish it.
first_steps: Pick a problem you personally have; write a 1-sentence goal.
Define a 5-feature limit and a 10-day schedule.
Build v1 with a simple UI and one main flow.
Publish and write a short 'what I learned' note.

goals.title: Start a 4-week beginner strength routine
goals.description: Follow a simple 3x/week routine and track progress on 2–3 movements.
first_steps: Pick 3 movements you can do safely (squat variation, push, pull).
Schedule 3 sessions per week for 30 minutes.
Track reps/sets and keep effort moderate.
Review weekly: adjust only one variable (weight or reps).

goals.title: Run a 2-week sleep reset experiment
goals.description: Test 2–3 small sleep changes and track how you feel daily.
first_steps: Set a consistent wake-up time for 14 days.
Choose 2 changes (no caffeine after 2pm, 20-min wind-down).
Track bedtime, wake time, and energy (1–5) daily.
Keep what works; drop what doesn't.

goals.title: Set up a simple budget you can maintain
goals.description: Create a lightweight system to track spending and plan bills without perfectionism.
first_steps: List recurring bills and due dates in one place.
Pick a weekly spending check-in time (10 minutes).
Track only 3 categories that matter to you.
Automate bill reminders and set a small buffer goal.

goals.title: Build a low-pressure networking habit
goals.description: Reach out to 1 person per week and have one short conversation to learn about their path.
first_steps: Write a 3-sentence message template that feels natural.
Make a list of 10 people (friends-of-friends, alumni, creators).
Schedule one 15-minute chat per week.
Capture notes: what they do, what surprised you, next step.

goals.title: Join one community and show up twice
goals.description: Pick a local or online group that matches your interests and attend two events to reduce friction.
first_steps: Pick one topic you care about (tech, art, running, volunteering).
Find one group and RSVP to an event.
Decide a 'minimum success' goal (say hi to 1 person).
Attend a second time within 2 weeks.
